definitions: To drink (liquid) by scooping it up with the tongue.
To fold or wind (something) around something else.
To overtake (a competitor) in a race to gain a lead of one or more laps.
To wash or flow gently against something with a light splashing sound.
examples: The cat began to lap up the milk.
She will lap the fabric around the gift.
The lead runner might lap the slowest competitor soon.
The waves gently lap against the shore.
